Row.Text: This mod aims to bring the world of George R. R. Martin's A Song of Ice and Fire to life in the game Civilization VI.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This mod adds new content including new civs, leaders, maps, religions, beliefs, units, and other elements that help make the game feel more like the Song of Ice and Fire series.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Leaders:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]- Eddard Stark and Jon Snow representing House Stark[NEWLINE]- Roose Bolton representing House Bolton[NEWLINE]- Tywin Lannister and Cersei Lannister representing House Lannister[NEWLINE]- Stannis Baratheon, Robert Baratheon, and Renly Baratheon representing House Baratheon[NEWLINE]- Olenna Tyrell representing House Tyrell[NEWLINE]- Balon Greyjoy and Euron Greyjoy representing House Greyjoy[NEWLINE]- Doran Martell representing House Martell[NEWLINE]- Daenerys Targaryen representing House Targaryen[NEWLINE]- Jon Arryn and Petyr Baelish representing House Arryn[NEWLINE]- Edmure Tully representing House Tully[NEWLINE]- Khal Drogo representing the Dothraki[NEWLINE]- Mance Rayder representing the Freefolk[NEWLINE]- The Nightking representing the White Walkers (Requires ACoIaF GS Mod)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]New City-States:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]- Westerosi City States: House Bolton, House Mormont, House Frey, House Dayne, House Hightower, House Redwyne, House Reyne, House Royce, House Hoare, and The Night's Watch[NEWLINE]- Free Cities of Essos: Braavos, Lorath, Lys, Myr, Norvos, Pentos, Qohor, Tyrosh, and Volantis[NEWLINE]- Essos City States: Qarth, Saath, Sallosh, Mardosh, Old and New Ghis, Faros, Ibben, Lhazar, Mantarys, and Tolos[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]New Scenarios:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]- War of the Five Kings[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]New Rulesets, Techs, and Civics[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]New Maps: [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]- Westeros[NEWLINE]- Westeros and Essos[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]New Religions:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]- The Old Gods[NEWLINE]- The Faith of the Seven[NEWLINE]- The Drowned God[NEWLINE]- Rh'llor[NEWLINE]- The Dothraki Horse God Vezhof[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]New Units:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]- Alchemist nuclear capable support unit[NEWLINE]- Scorpion anti-cavalry siege unit[NEWLINE]- Warlock range boosting support unit[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]New WMDs:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]- Wildfire
Adler, Gedemon, Antagonise (Dany Trait), Deliverator23 (Scorpion and Dragon Models as well as amazing tutorials), Laiyx (Original Westeros map)
This mod enables the Gathering Storm expansion content for the ACoIaF mod.

Compatability patch for R&F. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When this mod is enabled the ACoIaF scenarios will use and modify the R&F content including governors and the dark/golden age systems. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Currently this is just a skin for the governors to bring you some friendly faces and to give everyone access to the Rise and Fall content if you want to play ACoIaF with that content.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]
True start location map of Westeros including a small portion of Essos for city-states and Drogo/Dany
True start location map that extends from the Wall to Qarth
For testing, you should not be able to see this!
ACoIaF: War of the Five Kings
King Robert is dead. Who will succeed in claiming the Iron Throne?

ACoIaF: War of the Five Kings[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Disable both Gathering Storm and the ACoIaF: Gathering Storm mod before attempting to start this scenario![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Description: Play as one of the five kings vying for control over Westeros in this 120 turn scenario.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How to Win:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The only victory type is Score, you gain score from all the usual sources, but also from a new King of the Hill system that awards only the five playable leaders score based on the territory they control. Each city you control gives a bonus score per turn value with certain cities giving a larger bonus than others.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Play to the strengths of each king and you will be successful.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Leaders: (Difficulty)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]- Joffery (Easy)[NEWLINE]- Robb (Average)[NEWLINE]- Renly (Average)[NEWLINE]- Stannis (Moderate)[NEWLINE]- Balon (Hard)
King Robert is dead. Who will succeed in claiming the Iron Throne?
Westeros - War of the Five Kings
House Targaryen, last of the ancient Valyrians led by Aegon I Targaryen take the last three dragons and descent upon Westeros.
House Targaryen, last of the ancient Valyrians led by Aegon I Targaryen take the last three dragons and descent upon Westeros.
Westeros - War of the Five Kings
King Robert is dead. Who will succeed in claiming the Iron Throne?
Play a random game with the ACoIaF Leaders, Tech/Civics Trees, and other tweaks.
Play a game on a TSL Westeros using the ACoIaF ruleset.
Play a game on a TSL map of Westeros and Essos using the ACoIaF ruleset.

Tundra and Snow tiles provide +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production in addition to an additonal standard addjacency bonus for Holy Site districts. Extra territory upon founding cities.

Tundra and Snow tiles provide +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production in addition to an additonal standard addjacency bonus for Holy Site districts. Extra territory upon founding cities.

A building unique to House Stark. Allows the purchasing of Missionaries. Missionaries can only be purchased with [ICON_Faith] Faith. Holy Site districts get an additonal standard addjacency bonus from Woods.
House Stark unique Ancient era melee unit that replaces the Warrior. Does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
All units recieve +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on their home continent and have a bonus of +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against players following other Religions.
Missionaries and Apostles can spread Religion 2 extra times, and all Apostles gain the Heathen Conversion promotion. Gain the Wildling Unique Unit when they unlock the Civil Service Civic.

Wildling and Jon Snow unique Medieval era unit. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement if this unit starts in enemy territory. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking and -7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.
All units recieve +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on foreign continents and have a bonus of +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against players following other Religions.
Receive a second Red Cloak each time you train a Red Cloak, Mines built over the [ICON_RESOURCE_GOLD] Gold Resource provide +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Receive a second Red Cloak each time you train a Red Cloak, Mines built over the [ICON_RESOURCE_GOLD] Gold Resource provide +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.

A building unique to House Lannister. +50% combat experience for all melee and ranged land units trained in his city and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. May not be built in an Encampment district that already has a Stable.
House Lannister unique Medieval era melee unit that replaces and is stronger than the swordsman.
A Lannister Always Pays His Debts
Units have -2[ICON_GOLD]Maintenance, +20% [ICON_GOLD] Gold in All cities.
Declaring a Surprise War only counts as a Formal War for the purpose of warmongering and war weariness. Gain the Alchemist Unique Unit when they unlock the Apprenticeship Technology.
House Lannister unique Medieval era melee unit when led by Cersei, very weak and slow, but the first nuclear capable unit in the game.
Provides House Baratheon with a copy of [ICON_RESOURCE_Horses] horse and [ICON_RESOURCE_Iron] iron resources if you have revealed them, but do not own them.
Provides House Baratheon with a copy of [ICON_RESOURCE_Horses] horse and [ICON_RESOURCE_Iron] iron resources if you have revealed them, but do not own them.
House Baratheon unique Medieval era melee unit that replaces and is slightly stronger than the Swordsman, it also ignores Zone of Control.

Cannot train settlers, but recieve +50% [ICON_Production] Production towards wonders, +6 Influence points per [ICON_Turn] Turn and +10% [ICON_Culture] Culture, [ICON_Faith] Faith, [ICON_Food] Food, [ICON_Gold] Gold, [ICON_Production] Production, and [ICON_Science] Science per city-state you are the Suzerain of. Gain the Kingsguard Unique Unit when they unlock the Iron Working Technology.
House Baratheon of King's Landing unique Medieval era melee unit that replaces and is stronger than the swordsman.
House Baratheon of King's Landing unique Ancient era civilian unit that replaces the settler. This unit can be used to found cities, but cannot be purchased or built.
A building unique to House Baratheon. Replaces the Arena and provides double the Amenity bonus and an additonal +2 [ICON_Food] Food.

City Center buildings and Encampment district buildings can be bought with [ICON_Faith] Faith. Apostle units can choose from any possible promotion instead of receiving a random promotion. Gain the Red Priest Unique Unit when they unlock the Theology Civic.
A building unique to House Baratheon of Dragonstone. Replaces the Monument and provides +1 [ICON_FAITH] faith and +1 [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Prohpet point in additon to the usual bonus.

House Baratheon of Dragonstone unique Classical era support unit. Can heal adjacent units. If this unit captures a city or is adjacent to a city when it's captured, the city will automatically convert to the Red Priest player's majority Religion.

Cannot train settlers, but recieve +50% [ICON_Production] Production towards wonders, +6 Influence points per [ICON_Turn] Turn and +10% [ICON_Culture] Culture, [ICON_Faith] Faith, [ICON_Food] Food, [ICON_Gold] Gold, [ICON_Production] Production, and [ICON_Science] Science per city-state you are the Suzerain of. Gain the Kingsguard Unique Unit when they unlock the Iron Working Technology.
Renly Baratheon unique Medieval era melee unit that replaces the swordsman and heals every turn, even after moving or combat.
May form Corps and Armies earlier than usual (Feudalism) and always have one extra Wildcard policy slot in any government. Gain the Rainbow Guard unit when they unlock the Iron Working Technology.
+1[ICON_FOOD]Food from both plains and grass tiles. All tiles in cities with a Tyrell Granary recieve +12 Appeal.
+1[ICON_FOOD]Food from both plains and grass tiles. All tiles in cities with a Tyrell Granary recieve +12 Appeal.

A district unique to House Tyrell that replaces the Neighborhood and provides housing based on the Appeal of the tile and provides an adjacency bonus of +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture per Farm or Plantation:[NEWLINE]Breathtaking: +7 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]Charming: +6 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]Average: +5 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]Uninviting: +4 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]Disgusting: +3 [ICON_Housing] Housing.
Adjacency: Standard [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus for each farm.
A building unique to House Tyrell. Replaces the Granary and provides double the bonus.

House Tyrell unique Classic era light cavalry unit that replaces and is both slightly cheaper and weaker than the Horseman. +10 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength if there is at least one adjacent Reach Knight unit.

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for House Tyrell. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to House Tyrell provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food for them and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for House Tyrell.
Start with the sailing technology unlocked and the ability to enter ocean tiles immediately. Naval melee units heal in neutral territory. May from Fleets and Armadas earlier than usual (Cartography).
Start with the sailing technology unlocked and the ability to enter ocean tiles immediately. Naval melee units heal in neutral territory. May from Fleets and Armadas earlier than usual (Cartography).
House Greyjoy unique Ancient era naval melee unit. Can capture enemy ships.

A district unique to House Greyjoy for naval activity in your city. Replaces the Harbor district and is available earlier. Also removes the [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty for embarking and disembarking to and from this tile. Must be built on Coast or Lake Terrain adjacent to land.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement for all naval units built in Dockyard[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity.
Naval units receive +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in Shallow Water tiles. Builds Encampment and Iron Harbor Districts in half the time.
Receive a second Iron Fleet or Iron Reaver each time you train one. Gain the Iron Reaver Unique Unit when they unlock the Shipbuilding Technology.
House Greyjoy unique Classic era naval ranged unit when led by Euron.
+1[ICON_CULTURE] Culture +1[ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Desert tiles. Combat victories provide [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit.
Dornish districts provide +1 [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person point of their type.

A district unique to House Martell for city growth. Replaces the Aqueduct district.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It provides this city with +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture per citiezen, +1 [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person point of each type, and the usual bonus of a source of fresh water from an adjacent River, Lake, Oasis, or Mountain. Cities that do not yet have existing fresh water receive up to 6 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Cities that already have existing fresh water will instead get +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Must be built adjacent to the City Center. In either case, the Water Garden provides an additional bonus of +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Must be built adjacent to the City Center.
+1[ICON_CULTURE] Culture +1[ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Desert tiles. Combat victories provide [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit.

House Martell Medieval era melee unit that replaces the pikeman. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Coastal tiles. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Neutral or Foreign Territory.
Each [ICON_Capital] Capital City under your control provides +1 Influence point per [ICON_Turn] Turn. Receive 2 [ICON_ENVOY] Envoys after conquering a [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital City or City-State.
After researching Bronze Working all found or conquered cities receive a free anti-cavalry unit. Gain the Unsullied Unique Unit when they unlock the Bronze Working Technology.
Each [ICON_Capital] Capital City under your control provides +1 Influence point per [ICON_Turn] Turn. Receive 2 [ICON_ENVOY] Envoys after conquering a [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital City or City-State.
House Targaryen unique Classic era unit that replaces the Spearman when led by Daenerys. Has a chance to liberate other civilization's military units by turning them into Builders
House Targaryen fast-moving Classic era light cavalry unit, extremely expensive to maintain, but very powerful.
Mountains provide double adjacency bonus for Campus and Holy Site districts. May declare war on anyone at war with their allies without warmonger penalties.
Units gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on hill tiles and an additonal +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength while within their borders.
Receives a free spy and the capacity to build an extra Spy with the Drama and Poetry Civic.
Mountains provide double adjacency bonus for Campus and Holy Site districts. May declare war on anyone at war with their allies without warmonger penalties.
House Arryn unique, Medieval era heavy cavalry unit that replaces the Knight, can move over Hills faster, and has +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Hill tiles.
A building unique to House Arryn when being led by Petyr Baelish. Replaces the market and provides +2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in additon to the usual benefits.
[ICON_TechBoosted] Eurekas and [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspirations provide 60% of civics and technologies instead of 50%.
+100% increased [icon_production] Production towards districts and gain +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture on tiles adjacent to rivers.
[ICON_TechBoosted] Eurekas and [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspirations provide 60% of civics and technologies instead of 50%.
House Tully unique Ancient era ranged unit that replaces the Archer, ignores the movement cost for crossing rivers.
A building unique to House Tully. Replaces the Water Mill and increases the strength of your outer defenses in additon to the usual bonuses.

Pastures over [ICON_RESOURCE_Horses] Horses provide an extra +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +1 [ICON_Production] Production. Receive a [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic upon city conquest, +2 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 [ICON_Production] Production, and +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from each [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic, and the Palace has slots for 5 Great Works.
All cavalry units earn more experience from combat and earn +10 [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General points for kills.

Pastures over [ICON_RESOURCE_Horses] Horses provide an extra +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +1 [ICON_Production] Production. Receive a [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic upon city conquest, +2 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 [ICON_Production] Production, and +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from each [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic, and the Palace has slots for 5 Great Works.
Dothraki unique Medieval era unit that replaces the Knight. Adjacent enemy units receive -5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength.
Dothraki unique Classic era ranged unit with 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement with a [ICON_Range] Range of 1, can move after attacking.
+2 [ICON_Movement] Movement for the first 10 turns after declaring a Surprise War on a Major Civilization. Freefolk Camps trigger a Culture Bomb.
Cities do not incur war weariness, +100% increased [icon_production] Production towards districts if the city contains a Free Folk Camp adjacent to the City Center.
+2 [ICON_Movement] Movement for the first 10 turns after declaring a Surprise War on a Major Civilization. Freefolk Camps trigger a Culture Bomb.

Unlock the builder ability to build the Freefolk Camp improvement, unique to the Wildlings[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +2 [ICON_Food] Food, +1 [ICON_Production] Production, and +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Can only be built in Tundra and Snow tiles.
Culture Bomb adjacent tiles when completing a Holy Site or Encampment and occupied cities have no penalties to their yields.
Culture Bomb adjacent tiles when completing a Holy Site or Encampment and occupied cities have no penalties to their yields.
House Bolton unique ancient era recon unit that replaces the scout. Adjacent enemy units receive -5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength.
All units heal up to 50 hit points when they eliminate a unit and all units also heal completely when a city is captured.
Your Civilization gains +2% [ICON_Culture] Culture for each Great Person it has ever earned.
Your Bonus resources behave like Luxury resources, providing 1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity per type.
Your cities earn +15% [ICON_Production] Production whenever you are not at war with any civilization.
Your Encampment districts provide +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity each.
City growth rate is 15% higher in cities with an Encampment district.
+2 Movement if starting turn in friendly territory.
All units heal up to 50 hit points when they eliminate a unit.
Combat victories provide [ICON_Gold] Gold equal to 50% of the combat strength of the defeated unit.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to foreign cities earn +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each Luxury resource at the destination.
Your cities can now make Faceless Men units.
Braavosi unique Ancient era melee unit. Can enter foreign territory regardless of open borders.
Braavosi unique Medieval era melee unit. Can enter foreign territory regardless of open borders.
All tiles in your territory get +5 Appeal.
Shallow water tiles you own provide +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Your Trader units are immune to being plundered on land tiles.
While on a land tile, its [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route cannot be plundered by enemy units. Obtained when Suzerain of Norvos city-state.
Your Commercial Hub districts each provide the capacity for 2 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes instead of 1.
Your cities can now make Warlock units.
Qartheen unique Ancient era support unit. Adds +1 [ICON_Range] Range to adjacent siege and ranged units.
Your [ICON_TradingPost] Trading Posts in foreign cities provide +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith to your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes passing through or going to the city.
Units ignore additional [ICON_Movement] Movement costs from embarking and disembarking.
Your [ICON_TradingPost] Trading Posts in foreign cities provide +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes passing through or going to the city.
Allows spending [ICON_FAITH] Faith to purchase melee units.
Yields gained from pillaging are doubled for pillaging improvements and districts.
Clegane unique Medieval era melee unit.
Clegane unique late Medieval era melee unit.
Mines over luxury resources provide +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Units gain +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on Desert tiles.
Cities with walls recieve +25 City [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength.
Your cities get +20% [ICON_Production] Production towards wonders.
Your cities can now make Ghiscari Legion units.
Ghiscari unique Classic era anti-cavalry unit.
Ghiscari unique Late Medieval era anti-cavalry unit.
Fishing Boat improvements provide +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and Fishing Boats over Whales provide an additonal +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Provides an additonal +2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities in cities with an Entertainment Complex district.
Your cities can now make Tolos Slinger units.
Tolos unique Ancient era ranged unit.
Tolos unique Late Medieval era ranged unit.

Cities are unaffected by loyalty or amenities and do not grow without completing a unique and costly project; Conversion Ceremony. Unable to generate influence, favor, or engage in most forms of diplomacy. Unable to build most standard buildings, districts, units, or wonders. Unable to recruit great people or governors. Units are immune to Blizzards. Units of civilizations who are at war with White Walkers take 100% extra damage from Blizzards while in White Walker territory.

White Walker, White Walker Thrower, and Mounted White Walker units that defeat enemy units spawn Wight units, White Walker units that defeat enemy cavalry units replace the White Walker unit with a mounted White Walker Unit.

Other unique Ancient era undead melee unit that cannot be built and is acquired by defeating units. Slow moving and unable to heal from fortifying, but does not suffer combat penalties when damaged and attacks do full damage to city walls.
Other unique Ancient era melee unit that replaces the Warrior and is considerably stronger. Reduces city's [ICON_Citizen] Population by 1 when completed.
Other unique Ancient era ranged unit that replaces the Slinger and is considerably stronger. Reduces city's [ICON_Citizen] Population by 1 when completed.
Other unique classic era light cavalry unit that replaces the Horseman and is considerably stronger. Reduces city's [ICON_Citizen] Population by 2 when completed.
